name: Two unnamed spies

searchText: two unnamed spies group narrative scouts who move with prudence and faith, bringing back a report that stirs confident action rather than fear—an intentional contrast to numbers 13.

name: Achan (Achar) son of Carmi
blurb: His hidden theft of devoted things brings communal defeat at Ai. Joshua’s inquiry exposes sin, and judgment restores Israel’s standing. Achan dramatizes how private idolatry imperils a public mission.

name: Joshua
blurb: Moses’ successor becomes a covenant general whose leadership is saturated in Scripture: meditate, obey, act. Joshua embodies the transition from promise to possession—leading Israel through Jordan on
searchText: joshua person narrative moses’ successor becomes a covenant general whose leadership is saturated in scripture: meditate, obey, act. joshua embodies the transition from promise to possession—leading israel through jordan on dry ground, renewing circumcision at gilgal, and keeping passover in the land. his courage is not bravado but trust anchored in god’s presence.

name: Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem
